security_audit.summary: Prompt-based research skill using web search and fetch tools. Static findings are false positives triggered by pattern matching on benign content. The skill contains only documentation and metadata files with no executable code, no file system operations beyond its own directory, and no credential handling. All flagged 'cryptographic algorithm' and 'command execution' patterns are misidentified markdown formatting and natural language text.

content.user_title: Extract customer quotes for marketing copy
content.value_statement: Writing marketing copy without real customer language misses the mark. This skill extracts authentic customer quotes from forums, reviews, and social media to power conversion-focused messaging.
actual_capabilities: Search Reddit, ProductHunt, Google Reviews, TrustPilot, Facebook Groups, and industry forums
Extract exact customer quotes without editing or paraphrasing
Categorize quotes into pain points, symptoms, dream outcomes, failed solutions, and buying decisions
Identify gold patterns (quotes appearing 3+ times across sources)
Store results in structured format for copywriting workflows
Gather authentic customer language with context and sentiment data
limitations: Does not verify all quoted content is from real customers (AI-generated content possible on some platforms)
Cannot access private or gated community content
Does not synthesize or analyze gathered quotes beyond categorization
Relies on external platform availability and API access

use_cases.title: Build messaging frameworks
use_cases.description: Gather authentic customer language to create conversion-focused landing pages and campaigns.

use_cases.title: Understand user frustrations
use_cases.description: Extract real pain points and symptoms from community discussions to inform product decisions.

use_cases.title: Research client industries
use_cases.description: Quickly gather customer intelligence across multiple platforms for new client onboarding.

prompt_templates.title: Basic forum search
prompt_templates.prompt: Search Reddit for discussions about [industry/product]. Extract 5-10 exact customer quotes about their frustrations and pain points. Categorize each quote and note any patterns.

prompt_templates.title: Multi-source research
prompt_templates.prompt: Research customer sentiment about [product category] across Reddit, ProductHunt, and Google Reviews. Extract quotes in these categories: pain points, failed solutions, and dream outcomes. Flag any gold patterns.

prompt_templates.title: Competitor analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Search forums and reviews for customers who switched to or from [competitor]. Extract quotes about their buying decisions and what made them choose or leave.

prompt_templates.title: Messaging framework
prompt_templates.prompt: Gather 20+ customer quotes about [problem] from multiple sources. Categorize into pain points, symptoms, dream outcomes, and failed solutions. Identify the top 5 gold patterns and store results for copywriting.

output_examples.input: Extract customer frustrations about invoicing software from Reddit
output: Pain Points: 'I hate chasing clients for payments. It feels so unprofessional.' - r/smallbusiness
Symptoms: 'I noticed every invoice takes 3 follow-ups to get paid.' - r/freelance
Dream Outcomes: 'Would be great if clients just paid automatically.' - r/entrepreneur
Failed Solutions: 'I tried reminders but they feel pushy.' - r/smallbusiness
Gold Pattern Detected: 'chasing payments' appears 4 times across sources

output_examples.input: Research why customers switch project management tools
output: Pain Points: 'Our team was wasting 2 hours daily on manual status updates.' - ProductHunt
Symptoms: 'I couldn't see what anyone on my team was working on.' - G2 Reviews
Dream Outcomes: 'One dashboard where I see everything my team is doing.' - TrustPilot
Buying Decisions: 'What sold me was the automatic time tracking.' - Capterra
Gold Pattern Detected: 'wasting time' appears 5 times across sources

best_practices: Always verify quotes come from real customers before using in copy
Preserve typos and slang to maintain authenticity in customer voice
Cross-reference important quotes across multiple sources when possible
anti_patterns: Using AI-generated content instead of real customer quotes
Paraphrasing quotes instead of using exact customer language
Missing context about where and why customers said something

faq.question: Which platforms does this skill search?
faq.answer: Reddit, ProductHunt, Google Reviews, TrustPilot, Facebook Groups, industry forums, and internal support tickets.

faq.question: How many quotes can it extract per search?
faq.answer: There is no hard limit, but typical research yields 10-30 relevant quotes across 3-5 sources.

faq.question: Can I use extracted quotes directly in marketing materials?
faq.answer: Yes, but verify the source is authentic and consider whether the quote needs attribution or anonymization.

faq.question: Is customer data stored securely?
faq.answer: Quotes are stored in a Supabase database with row-level security. No personal identifying information is collected.

faq.question: Why are some quotes marked as 'gold'?
faq.answer: Gold quotes appear 3 or more times across different sources, indicating common customer language that resonates widely.

faq.question: How does this compare to manual research?
faq.answer: This skill automates searching and extraction, providing structured data in minutes versus hours of manual research.
